questions.explanation: The flex class applies display: flex to create a flex container.
questions.hint: This creates a flex container. Use the display property for flex layout.

questions.explanation: justify-center centers flex items along the main axis.
questions.hint: This centers items horizontally in a flex container. Use the justify- prefix.

questions.explanation: items-center centers flex items along the cross axis.
questions.hint: This centers items vertically in a flex container. Use the items- prefix.

questions.explanation: Creates a 3-column grid with equal column widths.
questions.hint: This creates a grid with 3 equal columns. You need both the display and column properties.

questions.explanation: Positions element absolutely at the top-left corner.
questions.hint: This positions an element absolutely. Use position and offset properties.

questions.explanation: flex-col sets flex direction to column, stacking items vertically.
questions.hint: This stacks flex items vertically. Use the flex- prefix for direction.

questions.explanation: justify-between distributes items with equal space between them.
questions.hint: This spreads items apart with space between. Use justify- prefix.

questions.explanation: items-stretch makes flex items stretch to fill the container height.
questions.hint: This stretches items to fill container height. Use items- prefix.

examples.description: Items stretch to fill container height

questions.explanation: Creates a 2-column grid with 1rem gap between items.
questions.hint: This creates a 2-column grid with gap. Use grid, grid-cols-, and gap- prefixes.

questions.explanation: relative positioning allows child elements to be positioned relative to this element.
questions.hint: This enables relative positioning for child elements.

questions.explanation: Positions element fixed at the top-right corner of the viewport.
questions.hint: This fixes position relative to viewport. Use fixed, top-, right- prefixes.

examples.html: Fixed corner

questions.explanation: flex-wrap allows flex items to wrap to new lines when needed.
questions.hint: This allows items to wrap to new lines. Use flex-wrap.

examples.description: Flex items can wrap to new lines

questions.explanation: self-center aligns a single flex item to the center of the cross axis.
questions.hint: This aligns one item to center. Use self- prefix.

questions.explanation: Creates a 3-row grid with equal row heights.
questions.hint: This creates a 3-row grid. Use grid and grid-rows- prefixes.

questions.explanation: z-50 sets the z-index to 50, controlling the stacking order.
questions.hint: This controls stacking order. Use z- prefix with number.

questions.explanation: text-2xl sets font-size to 1.5rem (24px).
questions.hint: This makes text larger. Use the text- prefix with size.

questions.explanation: font-bold sets font-weight to 700.
questions.hint: This makes text bold. Use the font- prefix.

questions.explanation: text-center centers text horizontally.
questions.hint: This centers text. Use text- prefix with alignment.

questions.explanation: leading-tight sets line-height to 1.25.
questions.hint: This controls line spacing. Use leading- prefix.

questions.explanation: tracking-wider increases letter spacing.
questions.hint: This spreads letters apart. Use tracking- prefix.

questions.explanation: text-5xl sets font-size to 3rem (48px) for large headings.
questions.hint: This is for large headings. Use text- prefix with size.

questions.explanation: font-light sets font-weight to 300 for lighter text.
questions.hint: This makes text lighter. Use font- prefix.

questions.explanation: underline adds an underline decoration to text.
questions.hint: This adds a line under text. Simply use 'underline'.

questions.explanation: uppercase transforms text to all uppercase letters.
questions.hint: This makes all letters capital. Simply use 'uppercase'.

questions.explanation: text-blue-500 sets text color to blue-500.
questions.hint: This colors text blue. Use text- prefix with color.

questions.explanation: bg-red-500 sets background color to red-500.
questions.hint: This sets a red background. Use bg- prefix with color.

questions.explanation: border-green-500 sets border color to green-500.
questions.hint: This colors borders green. Use border- prefix with color.

questions.explanation: Creates a horizontal gradient from blue to purple.
questions.hint: This creates a left-to-right gradient. Use bg-gradient-to-r, from-, and to- prefixes.

questions.explanation: Sets text color to gray-500 with 50% opacity.
questions.hint: This adds opacity to text color. Use color/opacity syntax.

questions.explanation: bg-white sets background color to pure white.
questions.hint: This creates a white background. Use bg-white.

questions.explanation: text-gray-800 sets text color to a dark gray.
questions.hint: This colors text dark gray. Use text- prefix with color.

questions.explanation: Creates a vertical gradient from yellow to red.
questions.hint: This creates a top-to-bottom gradient. Use bg-gradient-to-b, from-, and to- prefixes.

questions.explanation: border applies a 1px border around the element.
questions.hint: This adds a basic border. Simply use 'border'.

questions.explanation: border-2 applies a 2px border around the element.
questions.hint: This creates a thicker border. Use border- with number.

questions.explanation: rounded-md applies medium border radius (6px).
questions.hint: This rounds corners moderately. Use rounded- with size.

questions.explanation: rounded-full creates a perfect circle or pill shape.
questions.hint: This makes perfectly round corners. Use rounded-full.

questions.explanation: border-dashed creates a dashed border style.
questions.hint: This makes borders dashed. Use border-dashed.

questions.explanation: m-4 applies margin of 1rem (16px) on all sides.
questions.hint: This adds margin all around. Use m- prefix.

questions.explanation: py-2 adds vertical padding, px-4 adds horizontal padding.
questions.hint: This adds different padding vertically and horizontally. Use py- and px- prefixes.

examples.description: Button with vertical and horizontal padding

questions.explanation: w-full sets width to 100%.
questions.hint: This makes element take full width. Use w- prefix.

questions.explanation: shadow-sm applies a small subtle shadow.
questions.hint: This adds a small shadow. Use shadow- prefix.

questions.explanation: shadow-lg applies a large shadow for elevated elements.
questions.hint: This adds a large shadow. Use shadow- prefix with size.

questions.explanation: rounded-lg applies large border radius for rounded corners.
questions.hint: This rounds corners. Use rounded- prefix.

questions.explanation: scale-105 scales element to 105% of its original size.
questions.hint: This makes element slightly larger. Use scale- with percentage.

questions.explanation: rotate-45 rotates element 45 degrees clockwise.
questions.hint: This rotates element. Use rotate- with degrees.

questions.explanation: Adds transition to all properties with 300ms duration.
questions.hint: This animates all changes. Use transition-all and duration-.

questions.explanation: opacity-50 sets element opacity to 50%.
questions.hint: This makes element semi-transparent. Use opacity- with percentage.

questions.explanation: md:block applies display block on medium screens and up (768px+).
questions.hint: This shows on medium screens and up. Use breakpoint prefix.

examples.description: Element visible only on medium+ screens

questions.explanation: lg:grid-cols-3 creates 3 columns on large screens and up (1024px+).
questions.hint: This changes grid columns on large screens. Use breakpoint with grid columns.

questions.explanation: text-2xl sets font-size to 1.5rem (24px).
questions.hint: This sets a medium-large font size. Use the text- prefix.

questions.explanation: font-bold sets font-weight to 700.
questions.hint: This makes text bold. Use the font- prefix.

questions.explanation: text-center centers text horizontally.
questions.hint: This centers text. Use the text- prefix with alignment.

questions.explanation: leading-tight sets line-height to 1.25.
questions.hint: This controls line spacing. Use the leading- prefix.

questions.explanation: tracking-wider increases letter spacing.
questions.hint: This controls space between letters. Use the tracking- prefix.

questions.explanation: text-5xl sets font-size to 3rem (48px) for large headings.
questions.hint: This creates very large text. Use the text- prefix with xl sizing.

questions.explanation: font-light sets font-weight to 300 for lighter text.
questions.hint: This makes text lighter. Use the font- prefix.

questions.explanation: underline adds an underline decoration to text.
questions.hint: This adds an underline. Use the decoration name directly.

questions.explanation: uppercase transforms text to all capital letters.
questions.hint: This makes text uppercase. Use the transform name directly.

questions.explanation: leading-8 sets line-height to 2rem for more spacing between lines.
questions.hint: This creates loose line spacing. Use the leading- prefix with number.

questions.explanation: italic applies italic styling to text.
questions.hint: This makes text italic. Use the style name directly.

questions.explanation: text-justify aligns text to both left and right margins.
questions.hint: This justifies text alignment. Use the text- prefix.

questions.explanation: tracking-tight decreases letter spacing for tighter text.
questions.hint: This tightens letter spacing. Use the tracking- prefix.

questions.explanation: line-through adds a strikethrough decoration to text.
questions.hint: This adds a strikethrough line. Use the decoration name directly.

questions.explanation: text-xs sets font-size to 0.75rem (12px) for very small text.
questions.hint: This creates very small text. Use the text- prefix with xs.

questions.explanation: text-blue-500 sets text color to blue-500.
questions.hint: This sets text color to blue. Use the text- prefix with color name.

questions.explanation: bg-red-500 sets background color to red-500.
questions.hint: This sets background color to red. Use the bg- prefix with color name.

questions.explanation: border-green-500 sets border color to green-500.
questions.hint: This sets border color to green. Use the border- prefix with color name.

questions.explanation: Creates a horizontal gradient from blue to purple.
questions.hint: This creates a gradient. Use bg-gradient direction and from/to colors.

questions.explanation: Sets text color to gray-500 with 50% opacity.
questions.hint: This sets color with opacity. Use color/opacity notation.

questions.explanation: border-gray-500 sets border color to medium gray.
questions.hint: This sets border color to gray. Use the border- prefix.

questions.explanation: Sets background to blue-500 with 10% opacity.
questions.hint: This sets background with low opacity. Use color/opacity notation.

questions.explanation: text-red-600 sets text color to a darker red.
questions.hint: This sets text color to dark red. Use the text- prefix.

examples.description: Sets text color to dark red

questions.explanation: Creates a diagonal gradient from purple to pink.
questions.hint: This creates a diagonal gradient. Use bg-gradient-to-br with from/to colors.

questions.explanation: bg-black sets background color to pure black.
questions.hint: This sets background to black. Use the bg- prefix.

questions.explanation: text-green-600 sets text color to a darker green.
questions.hint: This sets text color to dark green. Use the text- prefix.

examples.description: Sets text color to dark green

questions.explanation: border-purple-600 sets border color to a darker purple.
questions.hint: This sets border color to dark purple. Use the border- prefix.

questions.explanation: h-screen/2 sets height to 50% of viewport height.
questions.hint: This sets height to half screen. Use the h- prefix with fraction.

questions.explanation: max-w-md sets maximum width to 28rem (448px).
questions.hint: This constrains maximum width. Use the max-w- prefix.

questions.explanation: gap-4 sets gap between flex/grid items to 1rem.
questions.hint: This sets space between items. Use the gap- prefix.

questions.explanation: mx-auto centers an element horizontally.
questions.hint: This centers an element horizontally. Use the mx- prefix with auto.

questions.explanation: py-8 applies padding of 2rem to top and bottom.
questions.hint: This sets vertical padding. Use the py- prefix.

questions.explanation: mt-6 applies margin-top of 1.5rem (24px).
questions.hint: This sets top margin. Use the mt- prefix.

questions.explanation: p-12 applies padding of 3rem (48px) on all sides.
questions.hint: This sets large padding on all sides. Use the p- prefix.

examples.description: Applies large padding on all sides

questions.explanation: w-1/2 sets width to 50% of the parent container.
questions.hint: This sets width to half. Use the w- prefix with fraction.

questions.explanation: h-screen sets height to 100% of viewport height.
questions.hint: This sets height to full screen. Use the h- prefix.

questions.explanation: min-h-screen sets minimum height to 100% of viewport height.
questions.hint: This sets minimum height to screen. Use the min-h- prefix.

questions.explanation: mb-2 applies margin-bottom of 0.5rem (8px).
questions.hint: This sets bottom margin. Use the mb- prefix.

questions.explanation: px-5 applies horizontal padding of 1.25rem (20px).
questions.hint: This sets horizontal padding. Use the px- prefix.

questions.explanation: rounded-full creates perfectly circular elements.
questions.hint: This creates a perfect circle. Use the rounded- prefix with full.

questions.explanation: shadow-2xl applies an extra large shadow for dramatic depth.
questions.hint: This creates an extra large shadow. Use the shadow- prefix with xl size.

examples.description: Applies dramatic depth with large shadow

questions.explanation: translate-x-2 moves element 0.5rem to the right.
questions.hint: This moves an element horizontally. Use the translate-x- prefix.

questions.explanation: backdrop-blur-sm applies a small blur effect to the background.
questions.hint: This blurs the background behind an element. Use the backdrop-blur- prefix.

questions.explanation: Creates smooth transitions for transform properties over 200ms.
questions.hint: This transitions only transform properties. Use transition- and duration- prefixes.

examples.html: Transform transition

questions.explanation: grayscale converts element to grayscale (black and white).
questions.hint: This removes color from an element. Use the filter name directly.

questions.explanation: skew-x-12 skews element 12 degrees along the X-axis.
questions.hint: This skews an element horizontally. Use the skew-x- prefix with angle.

questions.explanation: rounded applies default border radius for slightly rounded corners.
questions.hint: This creates slight rounded corners. Use rounded without suffix.

questions.explanation: shadow-inner applies an inset shadow for depressed appearance.
questions.hint: This creates an inset shadow. Use the shadow- prefix with inner.

examples.description: Creates depressed appearance with inset shadow

questions.explanation: scale-95 scales element to 95% of its original size.
questions.hint: This scales an element down. Use the scale- prefix with percentage.

questions.explanation: blur-sm applies a small blur effect to the element.
questions.hint: This blurs the element itself. Use the blur- prefix with size.

questions.explanation: Creates smooth opacity transitions over 500ms with ease-in-out timing.
questions.hint: This transitions opacity with custom timing. Use transition-, duration-, and ease- prefixes.

examples.html: Opacity transition
examples.description: Smooth opacity transitions with custom timing

questions.explanation: translate-y-1 moves element 0.25rem upward.
questions.hint: This moves an element vertically up. Use the translate-y- prefix with negative value.

questions.explanation: sm:text-2xl applies larger text on small screens and up (640px+).
questions.hint: This increases text size on small screens and up. Use the sm: prefix.

questions.explanation: xl:p-8 applies larger padding on extra large screens (1280px+).
questions.hint: This increases padding on extra large screens. Use the xl: prefix.

questions.explanation: md:flex-row changes flex direction to row on medium screens and up.
questions.hint: This changes flex direction on medium screens. Use the md: prefix.

examples.description: Changes from column to row layout

questions.explanation: hidden sm:block hides on mobile, shows on small screens and up.
questions.hint: This hides on mobile but shows on larger screens. Use hidden then sm:block.

questions.explanation: lg:w-1/2 sets width to 50% on large screens and up.
questions.hint: This sets width to half on large screens. Use the lg: prefix.

examples.description: Changes from full to half width

questions.explanation: md:m-8 applies larger margin on medium screens and up.
questions.hint: This increases margin on medium screens. Use the md: prefix.

questions.explanation: sm:grid-cols-2 creates 2 columns on small screens and up.
questions.hint: This creates 2 columns on small screens and up. Use the sm: prefix.

questions.explanation: 2xl:max-w-7xl sets large max-width on 2xl screens (1536px+).
questions.hint: This sets max-width on 2xl screens. Use the 2xl: prefix with max-w.

questions.explanation: md:justify-between applies space-between on medium screens and up.
questions.hint: This changes flex justification on medium screens. Use the md: prefix.

examples.description: Changes flex justification on larger screens

questions.explanation: lg:text-5xl applies very large text on large screens and up.
questions.hint: This creates very large text on large screens. Use the lg: prefix.

examples.description: Very large text on large screens
